text:
UN eulogises China for promoting rural tourism to fight poverty Published on : Friday, August 7, 2015
China’s rural tourism policies have been eulogised by the United Nations which the former used as a tool to fight poverty. Over 10 million people in the world’s most populated country benefitted by rural tourism between 2011-14.
Tourism is a labour-intensive sector providing a wide range of job and entrepreneurship opportunities in areas where other economic activities are often limited or in decay, said United Nations World Tourism Organisation (UNWTO) Secretary General Taleb Rifai.
The UNWTO Secretary General met with Chinese tourism officials recently.
Citing data from Chinese tourism authorities, the UNWTO revealed that more than 10 million people were lifted out of poverty through tourism between 2011 and 2014.
Chinese officials expect three million rural tourism businesses to receive two billion annual visitors by 2020, a figure that will allow lifting two million of China’s rural population out of poverty every year.
